meanings.definition: A condition in which distant objects are seen more clearly than near objects.
meanings.sent1: Her hypermetropia made it easier for her to read the board at school than her textbook on the desk.
meanings.sent2: His hypermetropia meant he needed glasses to see things up close.
meanings.sent3: The hypermetropia of the telescope made it great for stargazing but not for reading small print.
meanings.sent4: Her hypermetropia was like having a built-in zoom lens for faraway sights.
meanings.sent5: The hypermetropia of the eagle allowed it to spot prey from incredible distances.

meanings.sent1: Grandpa's hypermetropia meant he could easily read the newspaper without glasses.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with hypermetropia when trying to thread a needle.
meanings.sent3: The hypermetropia of the owl made it the perfect night hunter.
meanings.sent4: His hypermetropia was like having a superpower to see things far away.
meanings.sent5: The hypermetropia of the hawk allowed it to spot prey from high above.
